channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Japan deploys military after record bear attacks across country
item.description: Bear attacks in Japan reach historic levels as poor harvests and shrinking hunter population create wildlife crisis in northern prefectures like Akita and Fukushima.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, Israel says
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages, Israel said Saturday, the latest setback that could undermine a U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, a claim that came amid a sustained Russian campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: Egypt is inaugurating the Grand Egyptian Museum, the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization and an effort aimed at boosting the country's tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: By Samy Magdy, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump opens the door for sanctions on Nigeria over persecution of Christians
item.description: President Donald Trump has opened the door for sanctions to be imposed on Nigeria for allegedly failing to rein in the persecution of Christians in the country.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Lee, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: GYEONGJU, South Korea (AP) — Chinese leader Xi Jinping told Asia-Pacific leaders on Friday that his country would help to defend global free trade at an annual economic regional forum snubbed by U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Serbia youth lead thousands on march for weekend rally marking deadly canopy collapse last year
item.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Thousands of mainly young people in Serbia embarked on a two-day march from Belgrade on Thursday, aiming to join a major rally in the country's north this weekend that will mark the anniversary of a deadly train station disaster.
item.dc:creator: JOVANA GEC, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump's frustration with Putin goes nuclear, dividing Congress
item.description: President Trump’s decision to restart nuclear weapons testing as a warning to Moscow is being cheered by his Republican allies in Congress, while Democrats fume over what they describe as a dangerous and misguided retaliation.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, The Hill

item.title: Death toll from Rio de Janeiro police raid on drug gang rises to 121
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — The death toll in a massive police raid targeting a drug trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro rose to at least 121 people, authorities said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US orders nonemergency personnel to leave Mali
item.description: The State Department ordered non-emergency employees to leave Mali as the government there comes under increasing pressure from al Qaeda-linked insurgents.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Psaledakis, NewsNation

item.title: Trump seeks energy deal with China amid broader trade talks
item.description: President Trump is eyeing an energy deal with China, he said in a social media post Thursday. He said in a post on Truth Social that Beijing has agreed to begin purchasing U.S. energy and that a “very large scale transaction” related to oil and gas from Alaska "may take place.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Outrage as Swedish court refuses to deport convicted rapist, PM promises crackdown
item.description: Swedish court sparks outrage by refusing to deport convicted rapist, citing crime wasn't 'exceptionally grave.' PM promises toughest Nordic deportation laws.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, The Hill

item.title: Trump cuts China tariff after Xi signals tougher fentanyl enforcement, rare-earth pause
item.description: Trump announced a cut on Chinese imports after meeting with Xi in South Korea, citing new understandings on fentanyl enforcement, farm trade and rare-earth exports.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 4 Senate Republicans vote to rebuke Trump in midst of Canada tariff spat
item.description: The Senate voted 50 to 46 on Wednesday to eliminate President Trump’s authority to impose steep tariffs on Canada, something he exercised again in recent days by ramping up tariffs on the country by another 10 percent because of a television ad that criticized his policies.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Mexico worries its citizens might get blown up at sea by US
item.description: “We are not in agreement with these interventions, and we have a protocol that has yielded results,” Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: South Korea, US advance talks of $350B trade deal
item.description: President Trump said a deal with South Korea was "pretty much finalized," though neither government has signed an official agreement.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: Trump extends friendly hand to Xi in fraught relationship with China
item.description: Friday's meeting marks the first time the two leaders have seen each other face-to-face in six years.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump arrives in South Korea for key talks ahead of APEC summit, Xi meeting
item.description: Donald Trump visits Seoul for talks with President Lee Jae Myung focused on trade, investment, and maintaining stability amid growing tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump addresses US troops in Japan, pens rare earths deal
item.description: While meeting with new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi in Tokyo on Tuesday, Trump referred to Japan as an "ally at the strongest level.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dempsey, NewsNation

item.title: Ukraine's long-range strikes cut Russia's oil refining capacity by 20%, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s long-range strikes on refineries inside Russia have reduced Moscow’s oil refining capacity by 20%, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, citing intelligence from Western governments.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Venezuela suspends energy deals with Trinidad after arrival of US warship
item.description: Trinidad is hosting one of the U.S. warships involved in a controversial campaign to destroy Venezuelan boats allegedly carrying drugs.
item.dc:creator: JORGE RUEDA, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Half of uncontacted Indigenous groups could be gone in decade: Report
item.description: "These are what I would call silent genocides — there are no TV crews, no journalists," said Survival International's Fiona Watson.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation
